Class ForwardPanelMenu

java.lang.Object
  forward.ForwardPanel
      forward.ForwardPanelMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class ForwardPanelMenu
extends ForwardPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, java.awt.event.MouseListener

copyright (c) 2010-2011 e-Amrita - Giampietro Zedda Turin (Italy)

ForwardPanelMenu

This class implements all forward menu panels in a general way as listed in EnumForwardMenuOptions

As any custom implementation, as this one is just a project rule, forward lets you to tailor, if it needs, all parameters
directly on the java object used.
So it's possible obtain directly any object JComponent inside menu and modify directly all native properties.

  MENU_TYPE_PLAIN_BUTTONS 
  MENU_TYPE_SECTIONS_HIDE 
  MENU_TYPE_TOOLBAR 
  MENU_TYPE_MENUBAR

MENU_TYPE_PLAIN_BUTTONS


it's a simple list of buttons that you can put VERTICAL or HORIZONTAL.
In the simpler mode it's a one level menu of buttons.
In the more complex mode is a multilevel menu of buttons sensitive to mouse moving.
Mouse cursor moving causes a specific submenu panel to be showed just below, or beside of the menu item around the cursor.
The panel showed is a normal panel, in a specific frame, that will be closed on click on leaf item or due the mouse moving on another menu item.

MENU_TYPE_SECTIONS_HIDE


it's a VERTICAL menu realized with a cascade of couples of panels laid with BOX_LAYOUT layout manager.
Each couple of panels is a thin panel, with just the caption of first level, followed by another panel, with a further detail,
followed by a second couple and so on.
Click on thin panel lets to toggle the panel detail, that will be visible or unvisible.

Since:
21/nov/2011

Giampietro Zedda

Constructor Detail

ForwardPanelMenu

public ForwardPanelMenu(ForwardMonitorDesktop forwardMonitor,
                        java.lang.String panelName,
                        ForwardMenu menuLevel0)
Creates a ForwardPanelMenu object that inherits from a standard ForwardPanel class.
The descriptor of the menu, as an object ForwardMenu, will be used to build the menu.
As result, will be available for the application, a panel ready to be layed out that can be get by
getGraphicObject() for menu implemented by a JPanel

For menuBar menus getJMenubar() will return the JMenuBar object for setting on JFrame
For toolBar menus getJToolBar() will return the JToolBar object too

Parameters:
forwardMonitor - the ForwardMonitorDesktop active at runtime
panelName - the panel name with menu structure to be layed on
menuLevel0 - as a ForwardMenu object built at declaring time

getJMenuBar

public javax.swing.JMenuBar getJMenuBar()
Get the object JMenuBar for the current menu.

A standard JMenuBar menu will be always created from any menu declaring,
as a reference for all menus types. Informations to build different types of menus
are the same.
The menu bar will be set directly on JFrame of the function.

Returns:
the jmenuBar

Parameters:

getJToolBar

public javax.swing.JToolBar getJToolBar()
Get the object JToolBar for the current menu.

A standard JMenuBar menu will be always created from any menu declaring,
as a reference for all menus types. Informations to build different types of menus
are the same.
If the panel is describing a toolbar menu, it will be generated a standard swing toolbar. Normally a toolbar is made of buttons and sometimes of text field or comboBox. So not all
types of menu can be exchanged with a toolbar menu.
Only elementary menu items definitions at the first level will be used and whatever else will be
discarded.

Returns:
the jtoolBar

setJToolBar

public void setJToolBar(javax.swing.JToolBar jtoolBar)
Set the object JToolBar for the current menu.

A standard JMenuBar menu will be always created from any menu declaring,
as a reference for all menus types. Informations to build different types of menus
are the same.
If the panel is describing a toolbar menu, it will be generated a standard swing toolbar. Normally a toolbar is made of buttons and sometimes of text field or comboBox. So not all
types of menu can be exchanged with a toolbar menu.
Only elementary menu items definitions at the first level will be used and whatever else will be
discarded.

Parameters:
jtoolBar - the jtoolBar to set

mouseEntered

public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Gestione ingresso mouse per tutti i tipi di menu NON menubar.

Si gestisce l'attivazione di un submenu in un nuovo frame
Si gestisce l'oscuramento dei submenu non necessari
Si aggiornano le variabili correnti di gestione

Specified by:
mouseEntered in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
